subject: Re: [junit] Links Count and Access
msgSnippet: ... I m going to guess that you have more links on the page than you think. Show us the entire content of the response and maybe we can find it. ... HtmlUnit
messageBody:
love wrote:

> In my Httpunit Test :
>
> I have only one <a href="aaaaa.jsp"> in my Response.
>
> When I do
> response.getlinks()[0]
> or
> When I do
> response.getlinks()[1]
> I do not get error but the same href that I had in page why?

I'm going to guess that you have more links on the page than you think.
Show us the entire content of the response and maybe we can find it.

> I have many links that have same value such as
>
> <a href="a.jsp">hi</a>
> <a href="b.jsp">hi</a>
> <a href="c.jsp">hi</a>
>
> in same page.
>
> How do I use the Link Information so that I can use each of them
> separately without using the href= tag to find the link.
>
> Suppose , I know only response.getlinkwith("Hi").

HtmlUnit and probably jWebUnit (builds on HttpUnit) give you access to
your HTML documents as XML documents. This means that you can use XPath
to find these tags, like this XPath expression:

//a[@href="a.jsp"]

Find the <a> tags for which attribute href is "a.jsp".

Since you're already using HttpUnit, I recommend downloading jWebUnit
and trying it out.

Good luck.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
